channel.title: Sideicons
channel.description:
how can i disable them like in old tutorial island on runescape?
like this only inventory tab and logout
[img]http://i39.tinypic.com/2ir64pi.png[/img]
thanks;.

item.title: Sideicons
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

What zyle is saying should be correct. Have you tried restarting the client? Might sound funny, but I found when I send text to interfaces, they won’t reset to the original unless I restart the client. Probably because it has to reload the cache, but yeah. Try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Sideicons
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“cmcmvj, post:15, topic:427101”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=529792.msg3868423#msg3868423 date=1325165612]
Don’t set them all until the appropriate time.

There’s usually a section of code that looks something like

for (int i = 0; i < sidebar.length; i++) {
    setSidebarInterface(i, someInterfaceNumber);
}

So that it sets them all at once. To achieve what you want, you’ll have to remove that chunk of code, and only set the interfaces when you want to. So something like

if (player.reachedStage(4)) {// Let's say, first equipping an item
    flashSidebarInterface(tab);
    setSidebarInterface(tab, interfaceId);
}

[/quote]

i already did that but when i login i still can see the sideicons but cant click them…[/quote]

Don’t set them to -1, don’t set them at all.

Read full topic

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:427101”]Don’t set them all until the appropriate time.

There’s usually a section of code that looks something like

for (int i = 0; i < sidebar.length; i++) {
    setSidebarInterface(i, someInterfaceNumber);
}

So that it sets them all at once. To achieve what you want, you’ll have to remove that chunk of code, and only set the interfaces when you want to. So something like

if (player.reachedStage(4)) {// Let's say, first equipping an item flashSidebarInterface(tab); setSidebarInterface(tab, interfaceId); } [/quote]

i already did that but when i login i still can see the sideicons but cant click them…

item.title: Sideicons
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Don’t set them all until the appropriate time.

There’s usually a section of code that looks something like

for (int i = 0; i < sidebar.length; i++) {
    setSidebarInterface(i, someInterfaceNumber);
}

So that it sets them all at once. To achieve what you want, you’ll have to remove that chunk of code, and only set the interfaces when you want to. So something like

if (player.reachedStage(4)) {// Let's say, first equipping an item
    flashSidebarInterface(tab);
    setSidebarInterface(tab, interfaceId);
}

item.title: Sideicons
item.dc:creator: @cmcmvj cmcmvj
item.description:
@cmcmvj wrote:

Team_Rocket:

If you want to disable them just put “-1” next to the ID. If you’re wanting them to flash when the player makes progress, use Google. This isn’t hard at all, and It’s pretty much a must if you’re going to have a tutorial island.

i know how to make them flash while progressing but problem is i want to make it invisibly when you start playing or at quests…

Read full topic
